adviseScripts.text: A word of advice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: If Soline comes over and nags you to do something,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: please refuse all her requests.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: She relies on others too much. It's a bad habit.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Ignoring her won't fix that.
If I ignore her, she'll keep nagging.
*Sigh* That's true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: It must be difficult for you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: If that happens, please notify me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I will make myself of assistance.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I sigh while thinking of Soline.
*Sigh*
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: What even is this schedule?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Who made this?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Bring her a coffee without saying anything.
Is something the matter?
Ah... Coffee.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Just what I needed to keep me sharp.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Thank you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Ah. I must look so tired, don't I?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Forgive me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: It's not a big deal. You don't have to worry about me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I work alongside Brid, who has a lot on her plate.
Commander, I want to ask you something.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Do you prefer your coffee bitter?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Or do you prefer a nutty flavor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Bitter.
Nutty.
I see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I wanted to give you some of the coffee I bought today...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But, I'm afraid you won't like it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I'm glad to hear that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I want to share the coffee I bought today with you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I think you'll enjoy it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Brid while drinking coffee.
Did you know that Diesel likes to sing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Passengers occasionally report that some tone-deaf woman is bombarding them with noise.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I believe it must be Diesel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: What can I do to discourage Diesel from singing without offending her?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Tell her to stop her awful singing.
Tell her to fill her mouth with candy during her shift.
I'm not sure if saying that won't hurt her feelings.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: *Sigh* But perhaps there's no other choice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I will try to speak to her sincerely.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: That's a great idea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I remain concerned about Diesel's singing.
I have noted that you occasionally use our train service, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Have you experienced any inconveniences?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: A few days ago, Soline was sitting beside me and grumbling.
No, none at all.
It seems that kind of thing is bound to happen.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Thank you for your feedback.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: There must be something.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: This is for improving the service of the Ark Express.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: We are not trying to get anyone in trouble.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: So, you don't need to cover for anyone.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I discuss with Brid how to improve the service of the Ark Express.
Someone was saying that
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: the AZX is still far from completion.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Do you agree, Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Yes. There's plenty of room for improvement.
No. I believe it is perfect as it is.
Hm. I know you are trying to be diplomatic...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But the fact is, you see it as incomplete.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I see your point.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Although I know clearly that she is still incomplete...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: ... I'm still glad to hear you say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Brid about the good points of the AZX.
Commander, when you have a lot of things to do,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: do you do it all at once and then relax?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Or do you alternate between work and breaks to keep things in balance?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I do it all at once.
I try to balance it out.
I see. So, you are just like me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: You never know what else will come up, so I prefer finishing everything at once.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Judging by the way you work with Counters,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I didn't think you were the type to seek balance.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Your answer is very unexpected.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Brid about how difficult it is to be a burned-out office worker.
Nice weather today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Are you working today, or will you be going out to have some fun?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Do I have other options, aside from work?
I'm going out to have fun.
You understand your situation well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: A commander's work never ends.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Keep it up.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: You have many tasks that need to be completed today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: You really think you can just put them off?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I work hard with Brid.
Sometimes,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I regret handing over the leadership role to Diesel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I turned down the job because I didn't think I could lead the squad.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Now I wonder if I have given her too heavy a burden.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: It does seem pretty hard on her.
Diesel is a strong leader.
Uh... That's not it. Diesel is an extraordinary leader.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I'm sorry for not being clear.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I feel sorry for Diesel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: That's correct.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Diesel is a strong leader.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: If I keep worrying like this, others will doubt her ability.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Thank you for saying that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Brid about Diesel's leadership.
It appears the number of passengers using the Ark Express has significantly increased recently.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Of course, this is a good sign for us.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But, I'm curious why this happened. There haven't been any special events.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Commander, perhaps you know the reason?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid is becoming more and more popular.
The AZX is becoming more and more popular.
I'm asking you seriously.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Do I sound like I'm joking?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Fine. I withdraw the question.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Great minds think alike.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I believe that's the reason, too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Thank you for confirming it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I spend some quality time with Brid.
If you had a time machine,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: would you want to go to the past,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: or the future?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: The past.
The future.
So would I.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I'd want to go back to the day of the AFX Incident,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: time paradoxes be darned.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I figured as much.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: You'd prefer to see the future, not relive the past.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: That's probably the more normal choice...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I fantasized more about time machines.
When you're working, do you prefer talking face-to-face,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: or through text messages?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Face-to-face.
Text messages.
I see...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Using text messages for work conversations can be good because it cuts out any extraneous small talk.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: It's also easier to prevent things from slipping through the cracks.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But I can still respect your way of going about things.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I feel the same.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I think it's more efficient
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: at preventing things from slipping through the cracks.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I have a conversation about our working styles.
Commander,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: when you look at me, what do you see?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: A coffee addict.
A workaholic.
A coffee addict?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Don't be ridiculous.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: 8 cups a day is perfectly acceptable for the average worker.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I already knew it,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: but it's different hearing it back from someone else.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Regardless, it seems to be an accurate assessment. Thank you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I speak to Brid further about her habits and her personality.
Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Don't you have something to say to me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Did you finish all your work?
I'm sorry?
Yes, of course I did...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Ah!
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I forgot to receive a report from Soline.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: In fact, I was going to remind you that last time you asked me the time of the train I was driving.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But instead, it reminded me of the unfinished work.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Why are you apologizing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: In fact, I was going to remind you that last time you asked me the time of the train I was driving.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But now I'm starting to wonder what you've done wrong.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Brid.
If you had a day off,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: what would you want to do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Sleep in all day.
Day off? There is no such thing.
You should make the most of your days off.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: You can sleep in anytime,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: so it's a waste to sleep the entire day away.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Nevertheless, I will respect your opinion.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: So true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Keep at it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I have a conversation about days off.
Is there anyone you're having difficulty working with?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: No one comes to mind.
There is someone who's a bit childish.
That's great that you get along with everyone so well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But then again,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: if you're going to lead all of these Nikkes,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: that's to be expected.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I thought you of all people wouldn't find Soline difficult...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But I can certainly understand your feelings.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Brid about her co-workers.
Someone once told me that
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: lying isn't always a bad thing...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Do you believe there's such a thing as a white lie?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I do.
No, I don't.
So that's how you feel...
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I'm sorry.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I feel the same way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: The worst truth is still better than the best lie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: No matter how much pain it could cause me,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I would always prefer to hear the most devastating truth over any lie.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I talk more about the idea of lying.
A few days ago, I heard that Talentum Mall has new investment products.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: They claimed it could drastically increase any Nikke's salary, and asked whether I was interested.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Commander, do you tend to jump at new challenges that present themselves?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Or do you prefer to play it safe and not risk it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I often take on challenges.
I prefer to play it safe.
I thought so.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: That's why you're always heading up to the surface even when reclaiming it is by no means a certainty.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: But taking on too many challenges could cause you to lose everything,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: so I hope you don't overexert yourself and end up worse off for it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: That's surprising. I thought it would be the other way around.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: To be honest, I tend to play things safe as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: For me, the risk of losing everything I have
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: is not worth any potential profits I could gain from going out on a limb.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I talk a little more about taking on new challenges.
Passengers often tell me that
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: trains are a very romantic way of traveling.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: How do you feel about trains?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I don't have time for such flights of fancy.
I long for the day I can ride the rails up on the surface.
Same here.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: There's too much going on in our own reality
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: to entertain any dreams of travel right now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Traversing the surface on a train certainly sounds like a dream all right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: A dream that isn't promised.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: However, if a time like that ever comes
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: I would want to operate that train that you are on.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I talk about train travel.
I feel like time has been flying by so fast lately.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Let me ask you,
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: where do you think I will be in 10 years?
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: You'll probably be a member of the Ark Express.
You'll probably still be running the train like you are now.
I'm sorry to tell you this, but
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: as long as I am a Nikke, I'm afraid that's impossible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Yes, I'll be doing just what I'm doing now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Thank you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: If you ask me, there's no better future than that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Brid

adviseScripts.text: Brid and I discuss the future.
